title: The Refugees Form a New Faction
narrative: Those who lost the most in the transition - former whales, Path A voters, and the simply exhausted - coalesce into a formal faction: The Refugees. They exist at the margins of the new economy, some waiting to return, some building alternatives, some just watching. Their existence is a reminder that every system change has casualties.

manifesto_excerpts: We are those who lost when the system was 'saved.'
We do not dispute the vote. We dispute the premise.
Contribution scoring replaced one form of wealth concentration with another.
We will build our own path, or we will wait until this one fails too.
Every revolution creates refugees. We are the proof that V2 is not utopia.

internal.description: Recording 'the other side' of the crisis history
internal.output: The Untold Collapse - alternative history document

internal.description: Mathematical critique of the scoring methodology
internal.findings: Identified 3 edge cases where scoring undervalued legitimate contribution

external.description: Some refugees maintaining ties to main factions

rumored.description: Allegedly building a fork with different economic principles

price_discovery_progress.market_making: Organic only, no designated MMs yet

market_cap_evolution.driver: Organic demand, limited supply, growing confidence

echo.statement: The Refugees are not enemies. They are a feedback signal. A healthy system learns from those it displaces. Their criticism, when valid, makes us stronger. Their alternative experiments, if they build them, may teach us. Exile is not forever unless we make it so.

exodus_prime.statement: I was a whale because I invested early and believed. Now I'm a refugee because I believed the wrong way. Fine. We'll build something better.

establishment.statement: We hear them. Some points are valid. The door remains open.

defi_degens.statement: Cope. The vote happened. Move on or fork off.

collectors_guild.statement: We know loss. Some of us were refugees once. Time heals.
